page.title: 06Tourist Attractions
page.content: The churchyard has many unusual plants and shrubs.The church at Gerrams although largely rebuilt in 1848,has a Norman font and a celtic cross outside The church also acts as a distinct landmark seen out at sea. {Portscatho.} This is an old fishing Hamlet.It has several modern villas amongst the older cottages.A small pier shelters a tiny harbour which is popular with sailing enthusiasts.It has a small beach of sand and gravel below grassy cliffs and has good views of Narehead and Gull Rock across the bay. {Sailing. The Percuil River is an ideal place for sailing.Boats of all sizes fill the harbour at St.Mawes,Portscatho and in many parts of the Percuil River throughout the Summer months.There are two Sailing clubs in the area. {PTO
